oai_dc:dc.dc:title: True Christian Pentecostal Witnesses Church, 2001 January
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of True Pentecostal Witnesses Church, formerly Foster Chapel Baptist Church, located at 936 Lebanon Road in Nashville, Tennessee. The Foster Chapel congregation was organized in 1901, and their church building was constructed in 1907. In 1971 the building was remodeled. In 1996 the church was sold to the True Pentecostal Witnesses Church congregation, and Foster Chapel moved to a new building. The architectural style is Vernacular Gothic. The foundation is brick. The exterior walls are stretcher bond brick. The roof is asphalt shingle. The windows are frosted glass in the sanctuary, but clear on all other parts of the building. The doors are glass and wood. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: True Christian Pentecostal Witnesses Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Foster Chapel Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Foster Chapel Missionary Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
